result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Spenner III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any sentence Defendant is serving.

miscConds.notes:
$143 remaining balance of court costs from 15-CM-691 to be paid as a condition of probation in 15-CM-271.  
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with L.M.S. dob 9-04-1955 only as permitted in the Injunction currently in effect in 15-CV-183.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Benjamin Lutgen.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 2 and 3.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Cts. 2 and 3 dismissed and read in. Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def in person & by Atty Paul Bugenhagen.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Defendant has OWI 2nd pending; global resolution anticipated in Br. 3.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:45 am.
